content.text: This form is for documenting the first call with a potential new client. Fill in as much detail as possible. You can save your progress and return later.

items: Save Initial Contact: Click this to save any changes you've made. The form will remain open. You must save before creating the Client Service Agreement.
Create/Open Client Service Agreement: After saving the initial contact, this button will become active. Click it to proceed to the full Client Service Agreement (CSA) for this client.
Close Contact: Use this option only if the client is no longer interested or viable. This will archive the record.

content.text: If you schedule an In-Home Visit and save, automated follow-up emails for this lead will be stopped automatically.
This form is the main service agreement. Data from the Initial Contact is pre-filled. Complete all required sections before proceeding.

items: Save as Incomplete: Saves your current progress as a draft. Use this if you need to gather more information before sending to the client.
View PDF: Generates a preview of the current state of the document as a PDF. This is useful for a final review before sending.

Save and Send for Signature: This saves the form and sends a secure portal link to the client's email. Crucially, ensure the client's email and phone number are correct, as they will need them to log in and sign.

Submit and Finalize: After the client has signed, the owner must complete any final fields and click this button. This generates the final, signed PDF, saves it to storage, and sends a copy to both the client and the office.

content.text: The client-facing signing page will only show the fields relevant for their signature, ensuring a simple and secure process.
